review: I was visiting one of my work locations Oct 10th and got to go lunch for one of my employees and myself here. I had the Caribbean grilled chicken salad, and she had the Santa fe crispy chicken salad. We called it in, but she said it wasn't ready when she arrived, and had to wait almost 20 minutes more for it. It tasted decent but didn't have much greens in it, was kinda skimpy. She said hers was better months ago, and they changed something in the recipe. But for 23.00 for lunch cant beat the price. I like to treat my employees to lunch, so it served the purpose, not sure we would go back though.

This location has seriously went downhill,  we got there and they weren't busy at all but we waited about 10 min before anyone came to seat us, I think there was only 3 maybe 4 people working seriously . Our server was very rude. We go to chilis ALOT so we know what we like and how we like it and every time we ordered something it was either like an argument or just bad attitude , we ask for extra chips like 5 x before we got them , the food was horrible, I ordered chicken tacos and got flour tortilla with a piece of avocado, this used to be our favorite location but we moved closer to turlock and it's been about 2 years since visiting the modesto location, I was in shock how bad it was, smh I will never go back there!

I've had better steak on deployment, which means, chili's get a grade lower than " institutional use only" , or, they have no concept on how to cook a low grade ribeye. I get that they don't serve the best cuts but this was dismal. The server was prompt, appetizer legit and my wife was happy with her meal, hence the two stars

We've visited this Chili's after a day of shopping at Vintage Faire Mall several times. The servers have all been nice and efficient. The food is standard Chili's food. Not much changes. Everything has been served hot. The guacamole could be better, but it's not bad.

We ordered Fajitas and normally they come hot and still sizzling, not the case, it was all cold even the beans. The steak was overcooked, chicken tasteless and the shrimp was very low quality. However, despite our bad experience, the waitress was very  accommodating, it's not her problem the food was terrible! Unless things change for the better we won't be coming back!

So I'm all excited. I'm out on the road and I get to eat on the company ticket. Yay. I might as well eat at a nice place! Except there is a problem. It's Modesto. Yeah. A city that thinks it's San Francisco. It has a couple high rises. It has a parking garage. But it's not. It's Modesto. A city who's motto proudly states "At Least We Aren't Stockton." Come on. It's a cow town. So here's the dilemma - where am I going to go? If I were in the mood for Mexican, there are LOTS of great Mexican places here. But I'm not. I'm actually thinking about a burger. But a nice one. Enter Chili's. It's a known commodity. It's no Morton's, but it's no Denny's either. (If I let you eat at Denny's, it means I hate you a lot.) They don't do anything particularly great, but they do almost everything. The thing they do best is their ribs. They don't do great ribs, but they don't do shabby ribs. I'd have the ribs but I don't feel like making a big mess. I don't need to drive to the site with rib goo all over my shirt and pants. The burger menu looks enticing. The girl comes over to take my order. "So, is it possible to get this burger lettuce wrapped?" She kind of has this confused, estranged look on her face, thinks for a moment, and says "These burgers are really too small to wrap in lettuce, um, so..." Wow! Say no more, honey! And thanks for your honesty! I can clearly see that this isn't going to work out! Just give me the steak and shrimp combo, rare! You go to Denny's and get a steak, you get an overcooked piece of gristly meat that is tough to chew plus it isn't very big. This isn't that, it's a pan fried sirloin. It won't knock your socks off but it's a reasonable cut, and, as expected, cooked more on the medium side than the rare side but was okay. Again, this place doesn't 'do' steaks. They have them, they do a reasonable job. The shrimp? Well, they were okay. Again, not great, but not bottom tier either. The asparagus was there for presentation mostly, it was pretty much burned to the hot plate thing. I left kind of wanting more. Not more necessarily, more taste I guess. I eyed the Italian place. Should have gone there maybe. I probably could have gotten a ribeye. Oh well. Look, if the whole, one person lunch with an ice tea hadn't set me back thirty bucks out the door, (or rather, set the company back thirty bucks) I would have been joyed. Not overjoyed, just joyed. If it were half the price, I'd probably add a star for value.

Arrived around 9:30 pm, wait time was only 5 min. There is plenty of parking as this Chilis is in the Modesto mall parking lot. The service was really slow but the food was decent. We ordered the honey chipotle boneless wings to start, which I really enjoyed. We also had the chips and salsa with guacamole. I really like the chips here, they are nice and light, only issue is they break real easy when dipping into the guacamole. Thought I would go different and order the prime rib fresh mex bowl. It is prime rib over citrus chile rice with green peppers and onions, house made corn, black bean salsa with avocado slices. Topped with pastille- honey chile sauce, tortilla chips and cilantro. It was decent but I probably wouldn't order again. The kids ordered the steak and chicken fajitas, which are always good. Besides the slow service it was a decent experience.

If I could give a negative 1 i would Definetly give them that. I had the worse experience ever we were a party of 10 and were not even aknowledged. It took 20 min. To even get water served to us. It takes another hour to get our food. When the food finally came it was all cold the food was so cold there was a layer of Greece on top of it. They didn't offer anything in return. It completely ruined my sisters birthday. I will never be coming here again and hope everyone else learns from this.
Great reliable meal.  Chips and guacamole are to die for!

I really enjoy chili's always have. This is my first review. We came at a perfect time on a Saturday which was 12pm. We were greeted and seated real quick. Our server Rita was a sweetheart. She was real busy but still managed to take care of our every need. My special needs child had a meltdown and she didn't bat an eyelash. I really appreciate that. I will come again. Perfect for every picky eater in the family.

I travel a lot all around the US. Chili's is a great safe place for dinner. I usually order a salad - it's consistently good no matter which city I happen to be in at the time. On the weekends, I'll order a nice mixed drink - the drinks are consistently good. I recommend Chili's for the consistency and quality of the food and drinks.

TO GO Is so disappointing. Definitely never ordering from here again. So far all 4x, our order was just so unacceptable. Very unorganized when calling in & lines are CONSTANTLY busy. I had to literally drive all the way out there just to get a hold of them.
Service was excellent!   We sat in the bar area and Javy was quick and responsive to our needs.  It was a busy Sunday, but we never lacked for anything and checked in us multiple times!
This was one of the best times I've eaten here. It was Cinco de Mayo and  the service was still great. Out waiter was friendly and fast. From or drinks to the food all a round was great. 2 's
My husband ordered  California chicken flatbread pizza and had stomach ache  and diarrhea after eating it. The flatbread had no flavor and was not cooked fully.

The Santa Fe salad I had for dinner was exactly what I expected.  Fresh crisp greens, topped with fresh avocado and pico gallo was mixed perfectly with the dressing.  The three big pieces of seasoned chicken strips placed on top of the salad completed the salad.  Very delicious and filling.  Highly recommended this salad as a meal.  It is well worth the money.

There are no longer Chilis restaurants in Washington state where I live and I love the food and atmosphere in their locations. I would love to give my experience a 5 star but here is why I am not. We were one of 4 may e 5 tables in the restaurant, so by no means

A favorite of my brothers for their phenomenal steaks.  The server was really cool and the food and drink was top notch.  I accidentally ordered the nachos not realizing they are not a basket but prefer topped individual chips like 12 of them.  Originally I was going to deduct another star for the lower food count but the nachos as is were pretty decent. They all had cheese and chicken.  I did deduct one star though because I really felt that the nachos were not really properly pictured to avoid the sticker shock of standard nacho fare.  The toppings were minimal as the chips were already drowned in cheese and chicken so not really able to do anything else with them like putting tomatoes or guacamole. On the bright side the server was pretty fast with our orders and he was always on point with checking on our drinks and ensuring the accuracy of our order.  Next time I won't order the nachos and will re rate the whole experience.

The first tea that I ordered had black flakes floating in it, sent it back and asked for sprite but same thing then got a water. Spoke to manager about it. She offered us free desert then charged me for it. Food also made me sick for the next couple days. Disgusting

Good food stupid employees. The host saw my mom was using a walker and was going to seat us all the way across the restaurant. The service wasn't that much better either.  We ordered the usual meal so we know what to expect and the server was ok with the table side guacamole but she didn't put the salt or the lime juice on, that was for us to do.  Then a few minutes later dinner arrived and it was our server that brought it out.  She didn't see any problems with that and neither of us thought it wasn't worth the bother to say anything since no one in the restaurant seemed to care about their job.
The service was outstanding. Food was very good will definitely he returning here if im ever in Modesto again.
As usual from chilis to go our order was wrong.  I think this makes ten times.  Im gone.  GL Chilis.  Your to-go employees just cant read a receipt apparently.

Not a big fan of this place in general, been to a bunch of different locations throughout Northern California and this one is by fast the worst. The one in Stockton and Fremont are the best. The service is ALWAYS slow and 8 out of 10 times the food is either wrong or cold. I enjoy the queso and chips and my kids like to eat here so I go here a few times every few months to satisfy their cravings. I really hope they get better with custom service as time goes by I know a lot of people like to have drinks and appetizers here. When we went this past weekend it was pretty slow during our visit and yet we didn't get helped in a prompt manner and our food was wrong. I would say Red Robin has much better burgers

Well I should have known it was gonna be a horrible experience when we first walked in as the hostess didn't greet anyone, and when she was calling out names for when tables were ready the person standing 2 feet in front of her couldn't hear her. She would only say the name once and if no one responded she would just go onto the next name, didn't bother to check to see if anyone was waiting outside or anything.  Well, we get seated and our drink orders are taken and brought, we order and wait, and wait and wait some more.  It's Monday and the NFL is on, we seriously waited for food for almost half of the game, and all the while our waitress never once came to see if we needed refills or to check on us at all.  But that didn't stop her from talking for minutes on end to what I suspect was a fellow non working employee who was seated behind us.  So finally our food is brought to the table my kids are starving by this time and everything is ice cold.  Seriously I had ordered fajitas and the skillet and its contents felt as if they were sitting outside in the 30 degree weather for 30 minutes, oh and did I mention that it was a different employee that brought the food.  We still hadn't seen or heard from our original waitress for over an hour.  When I tell them that they need to take my plate back as its ice cold the waitress gets an attitude and then goes and gets our original waitress who doesn't seemed to be all that phased by my issue with my fajitas basically having frost on them, we then let them know everything is cold but since my kids are practically starving we don't really have an option but to let them eat it, since god knows when they would ever see food again.  The waitress then storms off flailing her hands in the air and a while later brings my fajitas back, hot this time, and tells us she is sorry but the kitchen is messing up orders and is messing with her money in the process. My sister in law ordered a salad which didn't have any salad dressing with it, we let the waitress know after she went on her little tirade, in the mean time the manager comes over to apologize about everything and to let us know she would be taking a discount off our meal for the inconvenience. In the meantime the waitress brings the salad dressing and manages to completely disappear for the rest of the night never once coming back, but she still managed to take her sweet time talking to the person behind us time and time again, so we finish eating and go to pay for our food and notice nothing has been taken off of the check or any discount what so ever. So we have to hunt down our waitress she then looks at our tag and leaves doesn't say anything then comes back and takes the discount off and leaves doesn't say anything, we ask her for a box she says she will get one but almost 8 minutes go by and she had passed us twice, I had to get up and basically walk into the kitchen to get someones attention to finally get a box so we could leave.  In all it took over 2 1/2 hours to get out of there. Needless to say someone basically lost their tip with how they mismanaged the situation by never trying to make up for it. Horrible, never going back to this location and yelp really needs to allow people to leave no stars, cause that is what is deserved of this place.

Food was great and prompt would definitely come back to this chili's the service was amazing our waitress Sarah has the best customer service ive seen In  a long time and she is one of the reasons we will be coming back. Keep up the great customer service Sarah we need more waitresses like you.

Busy place with a lot of great new food. Our waitresse was good but seemed to have quite a few table so we had to go a little longer on our refils. Besides that she was awesome. We had a very annoying person sit next to us and the waitress dident skip a beat.
Yvonne the bartender was awesome she was very busy but never ignored us and kept or beer full .
I'm with Kristin R.'s order.  Ordered take out and my 6 oz was 4 3/4 oz with no sauce and 2 pieces of grilled avocado and no salad :(  Maybe it was a bad day to order  ;(

I usually go to Chili's with my co-workers for lunch, since we only have limited time we typically sit in the bar area. The past couple times we got the same server Autumn. She is amazing! She's friendly and fast with the drink and food orders. And no pressure, she really knows how to do her job.  On to the food, I mostly order off the lunch menu which is cheaper and has good sized portions. I also like how they are constantly adding new things to their menu and giving you more choices.  But really this review is for Autumn, she is a great server and I really apprciate someone who goes above and beyond at their job.

I've always loved Chilies!! The food is always good and they make the best burgers, oh and I love their watermelon margaritas!  Last time we went we got the fajitas and shared them, they where so good!
Chili's is amazing. Great prices and amazing food! Oh and the drinks are pretty awesome too :)

Went to Chili's on Thursday and food took forever!  They brought some food and by the time they were almost done eating, half our table got their food.  It was cold and not very tasty.  Waiter was real nice, but too busy for everyone.
Food is terrible. Garlic bread is way over seasoned, chicken strips were soggy and rubbery.

My mom took my husband and I here for lunch. It wasn't packed or anything. The server was very nice but the food took over an hour to get to us!! Not even joking. They didn't offer anything for that either. I do know the people across from us were sitting before us didn't even get their food until after we did! I can't go on the website that was posted to go under. It says webpage not found??
Slow service, soup came about 15 minutes after I finished my salad. Soup was delicious, had the loaded baked potato. Server was nice. Food was good quality.
As good as a Chili's can be! Friendly bartender, good drinks, food as good as always. I like the tacos :)
The food earned 3 stars but the service earned 5. So I give it a 4. Our server was awesome. She was attentive and made sure we were always good.

So my family and I decided to eat at chills everything was ok until at the end our waitress gave us and attitude because we forgot to tell her we wanted to take our dessert home and she gave us the biggest irritated look and all we did was ask her for a Togo box so we could pack it ourself but when she came back with the Togo box she just kinda threw it at us and left. She came back and gave us our bill didn't say nothing no have a nice day no come again nothing so my family and I will not be going back to chilis every again especially with that shitty service.

So ordered take out & I ordered the Ranchero Chicken Tacos with extra cheese & pico on the side - my order come with almost no cheese & the pico was on my tacos. I'm slightly allergic to onions (thankfully I get itchy & not a swell up, life threatening type reaction) so I got to pick the onions out by hand. Thanks Chilis for the fail & labor intensive meal...

Bugs, hair and the American flag not flying on 4th of July weekend.   Son found hair in hamburger. Then a bug inside his hamburger. Meal started with all silverware with leftover food on it and it was slimmy. We have been to Chili's a lot but will not return.

Have you ever walked into a restaurant & felt so unwelcome? I had never experienced that feeling until I walked into this restaurant last night. The hostess was so rude & extremely ghetto (excuse the slur) I really don't have any other word to describe how unpleasant she was. She advised us that they were closing in 40mins & made my friends & I feel like a burden.  We were seated & our server, Jasmyn took care of us. The ONLY reason I am writing this review is simply to acknowledge this young lady. She was so nice & despite how late it was she kept a smile on her face the entire time. Jasmyn represents this establishment very well. We had a good night & enjoyed ourselves regardless of how the hostess made us feel (hence the 4 star rating) thank you Jasmyn! You were great!

I absolutely  love  Chili's  ! Best option  when you're  shopping  at Vintage  Faire  Mall. I love  there lunch express.  Comes with  unlimited  soup , salad, and chips and salsa. Omg there soup is to die for. All the soups  are good but my favorite  is the chicken  enchilada  . Sarah was our server . She is super friendly  and  very attentive.  She was quick  to  bring  our drinks  and take our order.  Our food came out fast and hot. She didn't  rush us at all. I hope  to  have  her as a server  in the future.

Good place to get a decent meal. Clean restaurant and bathrooms. Staff is friendly but every once in a while you can get a waiter that doesn't keep up. I still go if we get a bad waiter we just tip less or not at all. So far we have only left without giving a tip once. And I don't even think that waiter works there anymore. Been there many times after that.

I used to come here quite a bit but no longer.  Service quality has gone down hill pretty quickly. Food quality is hit or miss. Sometimes good sometimes bad. Too bad, I can't recommend this place anymore.

My boyfriend and i decided to come here for dinner. The food here is disgusting. My boyfriend ordered chicken tenders and he couldn't even chew the chicken... Disgusting. I ordered the grilled chicken salad I was not pleased at all the salad didn't taste good at all and it looked old. (Chili's is this really what you serve your customers?? Is this really what we pay for??? It's not) I felt bad for my boyfriend even paying for food we didn't even eat. We ended up giving it to the dog.
Food was ok.  Drinks are always good as is the service. The restaurant was dirty food all over the seats and floors.

One of the best Chili's restaurant I've been to.  Go to the bar area if the dining area seating has a long wait line. We ordered: Chicken Enchilada - Solid 4 because of the creamy and crispy textures all working well together. Fajita Trio - Nothing outstanding or unique but it's good.  Kinda sucks that beans and rice were an extra charge. Chicken Quesadilla - Good with plenty if ingredients. I'll be back to try the Baby Back Ribs!

The Staff was so rude, Not welcoming and Not a Kid Friendly Place so I will definitely recommend NOT to go to this Place at all. Saturday was My Last time I went to this Place.... One start only because it's not allowing be go lower than this..... Don't waste you evening going to this Place... you better off going to Taco Bell or something at least they will smile and make your food quick. Peace out Chilies....

Me, my best friend & my daughter went to Chilis today for dinner and I was really pleased by the service we received. Our waiter Alec/Alex .. Not sure. . Lol but he was really efficient & nice. It was pretty busy in there and we didn't have to wait for a table. Above all though, we were there for a good amount of time and he never made us feel rushed. (Which is a big issue with me when dining) So that won me over. It was a good experience, dinner was good, service was fast & my waiter was polite. Bravooo Chilis :))

Great place to go with friends when you've exhausted all the other offerings around the area. They are consistently good and offer up a nice, chill atmosphere perfect to house the overly-animated ones in your group like myself and a few others. The food is what you'd expect from a casual dining chain elsewhere but the difference is the wait staff are down to Earth and willing to help you have a good time. Now if I could only find zero calorie items on their menu, a man can dream.
i came in here to watch some sports an have a beer. And that's what happened.  Idk this environment wasn't very lively   It was actually kinda boring.

They get 3 due to atmosphere, price, and service (even though it took a while, busy) but food which is 2 stars for me was horrible. Don't get me wrong, I actually love Chillis but the one from the mall, especially when they are busy, left me wishing for more. Their winning "TNT craft burger" sucked. Cole slaw was just a dry bit of cabbage and only 3 fried pickles. They also forgot my side of pickles. Beef patty was good but it was as if that was the whole burger. If you order one hopefully it's better than mine. Chillis chain is great but this one I will never visit again. My wife's shrimp tacos and daughters grilled chicken were ok though. I think if you stick to their core meñu you will be fine, but don't bite on their new stuff unless it makes it to their core meñu.

Was not a goodf experience. Ordered cheese burger medium rare. Served well done. Asked to send it back  Came back just reheated. Asked to see manager. He was polite , but offered only to bring new fries. Was not charged for Burger.  Will not go back. Their survey form does not work.

Horrible customer service!  After we were seated and got our drinks we sat probably about 30 minutes until we had to finally realize that they haven't came by to take our order yet!  my sister in law had to all other servers walking by where our waiter was!   When we got or food my husband's burger was still alive!  He ordered medium rare it was definitely on the rare side so he had them take it back and remake it so he wouldn't get sick!  When they gave him the new burger it was the same thing very rare! We only seen our waiter like twice threw out the night!  It wasn't even that packed in side!   This is the 2nd time we had shitty service at this chilis! We won't be returning!

I am disgusted with this franchise and will never eat here. Chilis already isn't that good in general. If you been to any good American good place, you'd know that. But the second your customer service falls below par, there's no point in even considering to go here. Why a company would even refuse to accommodate a family, especially a disabled family, is beyond me! I understand there are policies in place, but our job as managers, servers, and cooks, is to make the customers happy to the best of our ability! You seem to struggle with that? When complaining about their meal, this family was met with unprofessionalism to the max, being ignored, hung up on, called idiots, etc. Instead of the manager taking it upon himself to fix the situation, he did the opposite. Extremely unprofessional. Terrible service. Terrible food. Will never eat here. I hope no one else does either

My experience was absolutely horrible my chicken strips I got were disgusting, they look big at first until I found out it was like 80% bread 20% chicken, tasted horrible like mcdonalds chicken nuggets, drinks were way to sweet, my date had to vomit out her salad 10 mins after we left, I even got charge for having played a game on their tablet I thought It was complimentary! 30$ wasted, I could of bought the same crappy food at mcdonalds for only 10$

For what was once a very, very popular restaurant chain that had long wait times for a table, Chili's is a shadow of it's former self. The food is very disappointing: even their hallmark hamburgers, once a pace-setting standard in the industry, have suffered severely in quality.  Their Mexican cuisine has also suffered badly. Their bar drinks are served topped with ice, a sure sign that they are in trouble. I fear that this company is going to follow in the footsteps of Applebee's, Red Robin, Fuddruckers, and McDonald's, circling the drain for too long a period before they finally close their doors. Sad.

Came here today with a party of 3 and we ordered our food and got the food but the service was HORRIBLE we were there for a little over a hour and the server never checked on us to see how the food was or if we needed refills on the drinks which we did need refills and they werent even that busy.

Love this place it's a good place to eat a big juicy burger or steak. I love the quesadilla appetizer they have. Great choices on drinks. They always have something good On TV too. And the bar is awesome great service and selections of beer.

I absolutely enjoy Chili's , I love their nachos, salmon,shrimp skewers, their perfectly seasoned loaded potatoes, and veggies, love that zing of chili on everything, and I always get the same beverage, pink lemonade !!! It's always a great meal, thank you for the great food, and great customer service !!!
Sitting belly up at the bar! Great Bloody Mary by Steve and excellent customer service! He needs to know his wine list though

Can't beat the lunch menu. Very affordable,  lots of food! You get soup and Chips+salsa with every entree. Price range is $6/7/8 depending on your entree. You get the unlimited soup and salad (includes cesar salad!) for $7 and you still get the chips+salsa included.  Our waitress was awesome. Service for our soup/salad refills was spot on and she anticipated everything we needed. We didn't feel rushed and the place was pretty busy. I've eaten at quite a few Chili's but this was my best experience.

Terrible customer service. You're working at a restaurant and the only reason you're in business is because of customers. Customer service is a given, so wthell. I shouldn't have to wait 10 minutes for someone to acknowledge my presence. I had 5 people look at me and not come to "serve" me. Horrible workers. Rethink spending your money here. Especially when it's TO GO.

I'm  normally not into big chain type restaurants, but these guys were on their game today when I went to lunch here with my daughter after an appointment in the area.  I wish I knew the name of our server as she was wonderful.  I'll update this if I can find my receipt with her name on it....she was that great.  Drink refills before our glasses were empty and she accommodated a special request without hesitation.  She was even nice enough to plug my phone in in the back so I'd have it charged when we left.   I found the service to be what I'd expect from a non mega chain restaurant and really enjoyed the time with my daughter.  Bravo.  If back in Modesto, I'd go here again in a heartbeat.

I like the Monterey Chicken, Enchilada soup, and a few of their desserts.   Where this place fails is consistency of food temperature and awful service.  Time and time again they just can't seem to understand you don not run off and never come back to your customer.  I have had to ask repeatedly for drink refills from any worker I could because my server must have went on vacation during their shift. Management does not seem to care one way or the other but they should.  I dine out 60-80 times a month and that is revenue they will never see because their employees can't understand what service means.

The hostess was impersonal, unprofessional, and we could hear her being rude to customers and then talking about them as they were out of ear shot. The waitress was prompt and kind. The food came out timely. The food was terrible. Very bummed at this visit. Not one dish was cooked properly. I'm guessing just a bad day for the Modesto Chili's.

My kids love eating here. Food is good and price is reasonable. Good service as well. I love how you can just pay right at your table and get receipt straight to your email. Great place to hang out as family time.

Probably won't come here again the hostess took 7 minutes to seat me and took in people that came in after me normally is understand wichever table is more available but I'm one person and their two and I came first second she was rude and third my food took a very long time to come and when it came it didn't have cheese at all on my sandwich I have an hour lunch so normally I don't care if the times a little bit long but I'm annoyed at the terrible service and long wait time .ive worked in restaurants before and their staff is pretty useless and the wait isn't worth it for a sandwich where hey forgot my cheese won't be coming back

Chili's is one of my favorite restaurants in Modesto. Their 2 for 20 menu can't be beat and the food is always delicious. I always recommend the cajun chicken pasta, it's delicious! However, their service isn't always the best but the food makes up for it. Very loyal customer!

Good food. We go here a lot. Hit and miss on the time it takes for food. Wait staff is also hit and miss. Hostesses are always friendly. I would not recommend if you are in a hurry in case the food takes too long.
I love this place! I go in at least once a month and request to be in Sarah's section, she's awesome and very sweet!

Had a really bad experience today when I found a lengthy curly black hair cooked inside my chicken bacon ranch quesadilla. The manager did go ahead and comp that and took my place with the quesadillas and fries. Then my server brought out a plate with just 2 quesadillas on it. Bye bye to my fries I guess then? Yeah I wasn't done, but okay. Then she charged my fiancé the full meal price even though every other single person at the table ordered off the lunch combo menu and he had the lunch combo menu in his hand and ordered a sandwich, she charged him the full price and wouldn't change it. She then charged my sister almost $6 for a side of chicken for her $5 salad... Are you kidding? I wish I could remember her name. She was Asian. And we sat at the right side 6 top table in the middle of the diner side

Really love this place. Chili's always seems to be our go to. Food is really good (love the fajitas) and their drinks are decent. Service could improve a bit but hey, I can overlook it during happy hour.
My cousin and I are usuals at Chili's. Atleast once a week we get lunch there and the food is AMAZING.

My co-workers and myself have an hour lunch.  We have tried on several occasions to patronize this place.  For the most part, we all (2-4) order soup and salad.  We always dine in.  And almost every time have to get it to go and try and eat back at the office.  How hard is it to make already made soup and put together a salad? The waitresses never smile.  I hate complaining like this, but we have all decided never to go back. They seriously need to learn better serving ediquet.  I love their soup and salads, but am done with the bad service!

We went to Chili's yesterday and it was quite possibly the worst service ever.  First, they need to teach their servers to at least pretend to be happy to be there.  I expect when I go to a chili's, I may wait a while, but holy cow.  After being seated and ordering with "Miss Sunshine", we waited nearly forty minutes for the food.  Let me correct that, for my wifes and I food.  Another five minutes for our sons.  It was so long that the ice in our drinks had completely melted.  The server said she would bring some more.  I have to hand it to her she did just as we had finished the meal and asked for the check.  Normally I tip well, even if the service was off, but not this time. In the hour and half ordeal she came to our table three times.  Once to take the order, once to bring us two out of the three orders and the promise of ice, and the third time with the check and the ice.  Really you bring the ice when we are leaving.  The bill was $57.14.  She got $58 only because I didn't have 14 cents on me.  The food once it got there would have earned it three stars.
i don't know why I don't go there often. Their drink deals are great. the food is good. And you'll probably go home with some leftovers! #/best part

My Husband, my Daughter and I came here for lunch because we had a gift card. I ordered the new Bacon Avocado Chicken sandwich with pretzel bun, from the lunch combo menu. I ordered it with a side salad. We also got chips and salsa, the salsa was a little to sweet for my liking. I didn't received my salad until my sandwich and fries came, which I had to take home because I needed to eat the sandwich while it was warm. Pretty sad when you can say that a Wendy's pretzel bun sandwich is way better than one here. There wasn't any real flavor to it. My Husband had the sour cream chicken enchiladas, he said his food was luke warm and had a lack of flavor as well. The other reason for one star is because our waitress couldn't get our gift card to work. So we had to pay full price for everything, which we came in thinking we wouldn't be. We get in the car and my husband calls the number on the back and it says it has $25 on it. We are so pissed we didn't even want to go back in to let them know. SO LONG, FAREWELL CHILI'S!

Horrible service.  The hostess' hate the job ! No one smiles , if you sit at the bar , they are rude. You sit at a table waitresses seem overwhelmed and tell you that. They never check on you you have to flag them down . Only good thing is Chips and salsa. All food comes out lukewarm .
Always fast service and the servers are delightful. I've gone a few times now and can't complain about one visit. I'll definitely keep visiting this establishment.

Tonight is ok..not really busy, almost time for my date to end,, lol.. a must have top shelf strawberry margarita with a shot of blackberry liqueur . food was good.. next time i may choose something different than my usual..I was pleased with service..stayed a little past closing. no problems..

Wow this is a bad chilis!  I don't expect much when I go to Chili's. The portions are usually too small. But this place had tasteless food and awful service. The promotional two for $20 is a joke, you basically get no food if u order off that menu. We tried sandwiches and they were awful. The waitress was a joke. Like a robot, asking how was everything and then when u say you don't like it she just says, "oh I'm sorry." She also brought our drinks with our food, not before.  So tasteless, small portions, and horrible service equal AVOID.

Sad to hear that you would not accommodate a local child (who is a hero by changing medicine awareness daily) who has a disability that was asking for a meal less than $10 to be prepared ahead of time. Don't you offer car side to go? Doesn't matter anymore because I would never support an establishment that wouldn't consider a small request for anyone.. Disability or not!

There are so many choices for food that this should not be high on your list. There take out is absolutely horrible. They need someone to take care of quality control. The salad we were given was about 10 small pieces of lettuce in a cup and no dressing and it was downhill from there. Not a good choice of z place to spend your dining dollars!

it was this night when i wanted to go here instead of Bjs.. i wanted to eat somewhere diff.. and......i made the horrible mistake ever... it took them so much time to take our orders and our food.. the food was not worth it.. waste of money n time..  next time i wont even think of this place as one of my choices.

Brought kids in for dinner and the waitress was so rude. I asked the hostess for an extra game pad and she said to take it off the table next to us, then the waitress comes up and says "did you take that off another table, you need to put it back!" I immediately asked for manager who came and apologized for her rudeness. Then she took 15 minutes to take are order when the place is empty!
Just want to say that we came in before closing tonight and ordered the 2 for $20. Everything was still fresh and yummy. Our server, Yvonne, gave us excellent service without rushing us!
I know this is a chain restaurant but I think there food is good if your looking for a good steak order the the classic ten ounce rib eye steak great portion.

Don't bother with the mozzarella sticks, but the Southwestern eggrolls are fantastic! Try a  pomegranate margarita and some tortilla soup! Not outrageously priced but not cheap. Parking can suck but it's not the worst in Modesto. Good happy hour, great atmosphere, and awesome for the whole family.

My girlfriend and I were very hungry after work Friday night. We decided to go to Chilis. The place was pretty packed but we were greeted relatively quickly by a kind hostess. She took us to our table and we waited for our waitress. Our server, Twila greeted us with a smile on her face. She did an amazing job. She constantly checked up on our table, she never let my drink go empty. She was very kind and attentive. The entire time we were there she had a smile on her face. Never once did she look unhappy or displeased with her job. The food was exceptionally well.  I care much more about the quality of service than the quality of food. I like the food at all of the places that I go. I'm much more picky about service. Visiting Chili's tonight was nothing out of the ordinary. The service, on the other hand was extraordinary. Twila is definitely a top-tier waitress. Some of the other restaurants in town should learn a thing or two from her. Way to go girl!

Is there a possibility to give ZERO stars here? I've been here a few times and let me say there are unprofessional hostess who seat you. The waiters don't seem to know specials or the menus very well...  on busy nights i've had them screw up my order. Basic American chain food.. the only thing that i good is bottomless Chips & salsa @ the bar during happy hour... This way no waiters are there, except the bar waiters... At least the bar waiters haven't messed up my order of drinks and appetizers.
Awesome food awesome service great family  atmosphere. I have tried many things in the menu and and I have yet to find something that I didn't like  will return again

It's a Chili's It is by the mall and we were hungry. The salads we had were drenched in dressing. They do have a bar so that is a plus. I have never really been fond of chili's. There menu items to me are to much like the frozen food section at grocery store.

Extremely rude service! Took twice as long to even be seated then after the super nice hostess informed the waitress she still had two parties and had to work we were looked at with rolled eyes and huffing! Never coming here again!
Never used to enjoy Chili's but after many years stopped in for lunch great new menu that was really affordable

I'm not in to big chain restaurants but Chili's is alright in my book. Our server, Cameron, was on top of it! Drinks refilled before I even noticed it was time. He explained the specials and put up with our group. we wemt yesterday during lunch and it was a pleasant time. The food came out about the same time, hot and good. I had the salmon and broccoli and I couldnt finish it. Probably because we went to town on appetizers-chips, salsa, guacamole, and potato skins.

This is how service should be in a restaurant! Priscilla, our waitress, was so awesome. She should teach classes on how to be a waitress/waiter. She was on top of it. She had perfect timing when it came to asking us if we were ready to order to checking on us while eating and giving us time to order dessert and not rush us out the door.  I ordered the loaded potato skins sans green onions with ranch and they were pretty good and not very greasy unlike some places. Our entrees were the Southern Smokehouse Burger with no bbq sauce and no pickles and the Crispy Crispers with ranch. The burger apparently was made with extra pickles rather than no pickles, BUT it didn't come to the table that way. Priscilla told us she noticed the mistake and promptly had them remake the burger so when it came to the table, it was perfect! The crispy crispers were done perfectly...the fries were properly seasoned, the corn on the cob hot, sweet and juicy and the chicken had the proper amount of crunch covering the juicy chicken. Dessert was the brownie sundae and I admit, I wasn't expecting it to be anything special, but my god was I proved wrong. That brownie sundae was so freaking good...I mean it was PERFECT! Ice cream for every bite of hot brownie, thats right, the brownie is made fresh to order...mmmm it was delish! This was the best experience I have ever had in a restaurant. I never felt rushed, even when it got busy with the dinner rush and surprisingly it never seemed too loud in there, which is such a nice thing when you don't have to yell across the table to be heard by your dinner companion. From start to finish, I couldn't be happier and I can't wait to go back again.  Thank you to our waitress Priscilla...you are the special touch that made the whole dining experience the best ever! :)

Only 3 because. The new Zeus machine is cute game it also allows you to pay your bill at the table. Our waiter didn't explain it, so we waited and another server came over showed me how to pay myself, and it has a sliding scale for tip. Really when did the client become the employee.

: (   i really dont know why i tried this place more than once but it was never good. Our hostess kept questioning me on how many people were going to be there, i was with my husband and daughter and were waiting for 2 other people to show up and i told her this but she proceeded to ask me how many and if i was for sure on the number!  Food was tasteless im glad i got a margarita or im sure i would of just left and got food some where else. Plus i always feel cramped in their seats, they just seem awkward, who knows could just be me :)
Tiny portions. Undercooked chicken w/way too much garnish. Absolute crap.

I have loved chili's food for years! Service has always been great, then came the stupid "helpful" p.o.s. at table system (they should call it the dumb waiter)... from that time on, service has gone so far down that I will never go back until that awful thing is gone! U have to ask for a soda refill thru the damn thing, and if ur server hasn't entered ur beverage into the system, good luck. Need the sauce that comes with ur meal that ur server was going to bring right back but never did, good luck. Need extra napkins because someone with u ordered ribs, good luck. None of these options r on the "dumb waiter"... good luck!

meh. i really shouldn't yelp a bout chain restaurants. im spoiled on quality over quantity and real ethnic food from hole in the wall places in the bay area. i would compare it to an apple bees. but i think i like apple bees better. i was disappointed in my strawberry lemonade. it just tasted like a kinda sweet lemon water colored with dirty dish water LOL. if you order one ask for xtra strawberries. one smooshy strawberry wont cut it.
I want my money back, money back, money back... This place is a waste. With so many other eateries in Modesto, why would anyone waste time here. AVOID.

Yuck! Fajitas were flavorless and chicken tenders were pure salt. Tenders are always salty, but these tasted like they put 4 times the amount of salt they should have.. Not edible. The only good food were the chips, guac and salsa. Service was average. I won't be back.

I come in frequently for the happy hour and so far its been a good experience every time. They have good appetizers and the drink specials are reasonably priced. Plenty of beers on tap and free chips and salsa .The servers are all really friendly.I highly recommend this place for happy hour.

We usually hit Chilis once a month and its usually decent, never a great meal, but decent. Went a few days ago and it was horrible. Was not greeted at the door, took awhile to get a table and then it seemed to take awhile to get a server. First off the drink order was wrong, thought no big deal at the time but it went downhill from there. Server didn't come back for a long time to get our order, there were 2 servers and 5 small tables at the time. Got our appetizer of potato skins, they were not crisp but soggy, and there was a lot of potato meat, they are usually a little meat and nice crisp skin. Then the meals came out. I had chicken and shrimp fajitas, the whole plate had a pool of oil the meal was sitting in and the bells and onions were practically raw. The other order was grilled chicken sandwich, the tomato was crispy, the bun was cold and the fries were barely luke warm and looked like they had been fried a couple of times. During this time we tried to get the staff of our waitperson but they were no where to be seen. Felt like we just threw forty bucks away. It will be a long time before we go back.
Slow food service. Bad food for outrageous price.  Waiter was nice but slow. Had to ask mgr about 15 min late soup (got half sandwich with soup). At least he comp'd my meal.
Mediocre food, it's pretty much impossible to find anything on the menu that doesn't have an entire days worth of calories in it.

Wow, who knew I would 1. ever go to a Chili's and 2. actually give it 4 stars!! Srsly, I could not have been more happier about my experience here. As a former restaurant manager I just look for the little nuances that create an "above and beyond" experience- and chili's has it all.  For one, I came in (the door was opened for me) sans gramma and mom to put our name in- since it was high lunch time and thought there might be a wait- there wasn't and the host offered to take me right to my table, despite my whole party being there (huge plus!) but I decline since gramma and mom were right behind me, when they came up, noticing my gramma's difficult time walking they opened BOTH doors for her- huge plus, totally taking advantage of hospitable opportunities.  The second thing I loved about chili's is they have a "guiltless" menu- as a former rest. mngr. I def packed on a few extra lbs- so I have been watching my weight and having a guide there really helped- I also love healthier, low fat, high grain options (I got a chicken sandwich on whole wheat bun with steamed broc accompanied by a balsamic vinaigrette - it was WAY good). Now, granted, it is a bit cheesy to have a "low cal" menu- but with a 5 page menu I appreciated a simplified version for me.  Service was great and attentive and the food was good- a great choice if you're at the mall!

Love it ! Definitely one of my favorite restaurants to eat at. The servers are always polite & refills our drinks. My husband & I are young newly weds and the prices are reasonable. The two for twenty $ is usually what we get.
Dont'cha just love those baby back ribs???? Huh?? Dont'cha??? Hell I do.

I believe that there is no reason why chain restaurants can not produce good quality. Chili's obviously believes otherwise. Many years ago Chili's in the bay area was my happy hour hang out with co-workers. I had not visited one since and probably should have stayed away and kept the happy memories. We ordered, but could not eat, what has to be the most awful and disgusting fajitas produced anywhere. This is processed food at it's very worst. To be this bad, it had to have come frozen in a pouch produced in some far off factory. It did come with rice and beans, but like the worst scenes of a horror movie, it's best to close your eyes and cover your ears, to the side dish. The description of some things should be avoided. To the restaurant's credit they did ask if we wanted something else and deducted $10. from the bill. After waiting what seemed an eternity for this horrid fare, we wern't about to wait any longer to give the place a second chance. A polite and attentive wait staff, but unfortunatly they work for an absolutely lousy restaurant.

Service was less than desirable, once our server took our order and brought it to us, never saw the guy again. My husband ordered Carbanaro Steak which should have come with onions, green and red peppers, mushrooms and a cheese sauce, had tons of mushrooms, maybe at best three thin slices of red peppers and a slice of green peppers and some onions, and for the cheese sauce.... if there was cheese in it, it sure didnt taste like it! The server offered to take it back, but fear of a "sneezer" stopped my husband from sending it back. Like I said, our server never came back to see if we needed re-fills on our drinks, when we were done we had to ask the greeter at the door for our check, then had to wait to get the check back to sign off, and our credit card wasnt with the check. My husband had to chase down the server to get the credit card. I would have said someting to the waiter and manager but my husband wouldnt let me. I just know I wont be going back.

Just left Chili's.  Will not eat there again.  I ordered Fajitas and had to pay extra for rice and beans.  My husband had ribs.  They were dry.  The  service was not that good,,  Poor girl had a hard time with 10 people.  Also, on your tab it print's out the amount you are supposed to tip.

I love the food at Chili's! The food is deliciuos and they don't skimp on the portions,you get a lot of food!! Everything is served piping HOT!! The service is great as well as the atmosphere and the prices are great!!
